forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 1am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. North northwest wind around 5 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 5 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As night drapes its velvet cloak over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a damp chill, hinting at the rain that may soon grace the region. Clouds hang low in the sky, creating a shroud that envelops the evening, with temperatures settling around a cool 50 degrees. This whisper of moisture, combined with a gentle north-northwest breeze, speaks of impending precipitation, as there’s a 40% chance that the sky will open its heart after 1 AM. Should the rain arrive, it promises to bring only a light touch, less than a tenth of an inch—a mere kiss from the heavens.

The dawn of Wednesday promises a tapestry of clouds punctuated by moments of fleeting sunshine. With a forecasted high that will dance around 57 and drop later to a brisk 53, layers will be your ally. As winds pick up, gusting to 22 mph, a snug jacket will serve you well, perhaps accompanied by a sturdy pair of shoes to navigate the slick streets should the rain hang around. It’s a day that invites gentle exploration—perhaps a stroll through your neighborhood with warm coffee in hand, visiting a cozy bookstore, or indulging in the quiet comforts of your favorite café as the world rushes past. Aiming for the mundane might just uncover the extraordinary in your daily routine, as you slip into the rhythm of this moody yet captivating cityscape.
